page.title: 07CHANGES IN WICHENFORD
page.content: There are many{elderly residents}in Wichenford, some in their 80's and even 90's. These people are content living here, and eagerly recalled their early days in Wichenford. When the{council estate}was built in 1953, the village moved to its present site; earlier, the hub of life was on {Castle Hill,}where the one pub, the Mason's Arms, still stands. 0lder people remember a variety of {farming,}including: sugar beet, field beans, potatoes, and poultry; and several remembered the{first tractors. { War time}bears special memories of {evacuees}coming from London,{rationing of food, and{special war time duties. One lady remebers being{"in service" a career remote to today's youngsters. Most people regretted the effects of the{closure of the school}and the{loss {of a resident vicar}in the Village.
